source.93c3a5d4:
from google.cloud import bigquery

# Create a "Client" object
client = bigquery.Client()

# Construct a reference to the "chicago_crime" dataset
dataset_ref = client.dataset("chicago_crime", project="bigquery-public-data")

# API request - fetch the dataset
dataset = client.get_dataset(dataset_ref)
source.1f0e1cf2:

v=list(client.list_tables(dataset))
len(v)

source.28c4c595:
# Introduction

The first test of your new data exploration skills uses data describing crime in the city of Chicago.

Before you get started, run the following cell. It sets up the automated feedback system to review your answers.
source.d8531ecf:
### 3) Create a crime map

If you wanted to create a map with a dot at the location of each crime, what are the names of the two fields you likely need to pull out of the `crime` table to plot the crimes on a map?

source.49e18f00: Thinking about the question above, there are a few columns that appear to have geographic data. Look at a few values (with the `list_rows()` command) to see if you can determine their relationship.  Two columns will still be hard to interpret. But it should be obvious how the `location` column relates to `latitude` and `longitude`.
